intro: Pultenaea rostrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers in late winter to early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its slender, upright form and showy blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
